Existing wording: the hub.topic which is an unique url identifying the session, and the cast-hub which is the base url of the Hub

hl7-fhircast-bot edited Issue #120

## May 2019 Ballot Comment: Provide simple text to introduce hub.topic and cast-hub.

Submitted by Ricardo Quintano Neira on behalf of @bvdh
Chapter/section: Session Discovery
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: A-S Clarification

Summary: Provide simple text to introduce hub.topic and cast-hub.

Comment: Provide simple text to introduce these concepts: hub.topic, cast-hub.

Existing wording: the hub.topic which is an unique url identifying the session, and the cast-hub which is the base url of the Hub

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

NiklasSvenzen commented on Issue #120

Existing wording: Before establishing a subscription, an app must know the hub.topic which is an unique url identifying the session, and the cast-hub which is the base url of the Hub. The app discovers these two urls as part of a SMART on FHIR launch.

Proposed wording: Before establishing a subscription, an app must know the hub.topic which is an unique url identifying the session, and the cast-hub which is the base url of the Hub. The app discovers these two urls as part of a SMART on FHIR launch. A session identified by hub.topic is an abstract notion that represents a shared workspace, such as user's login session over multiple applications or a shared view of one application distributed to multiple users.

## :landline: II Working Group Vote (6-18-2019)
Block vote

@isaacvetter moved the following disposition, seconded by Ricardo Quintano Neira

Disposition: Persuasive with mod
Disposition Comment: Will fix as described in the issue comments or by the commenter

:+1: For: 10
:expressionless: Abstain: 2
:-1: Against: 0

:tada: The motion passed! :tada:
